name: mocha-test-lens
description: Run individual Mocha tests with CodeLens in TypeScript files

mochaTestLens.env.description: Environment variables to set when running tests. Example: {"NODE_ENV": "test", "TS_NODE_TRANSPILE_ONLY": "true"}
mochaTestLens.env.markdownDescription:
Environment variables to set when running tests.

Example:
```json
{
  "NODE_ENV": "test",
  "TS_NODE_TRANSPILE_ONLY": "true"
}
```

mochaTestLens.nodePath.description: Path to the node binary. Leave empty to auto-detect using VS Code's node resolution (recommended).
mochaTestLens.nodePath.markdownDescription:
Path to the node binary. Leave empty to auto-detect using VS Code's node resolution (recommended).

When empty, the extension will use VS Code's built-in node detection, which typically uses the node from your system PATH or the one VS Code is running with.

Examples:
- `/usr/bin/node` - System node
- `/nix/store/.../bin/node` - Nix-managed node
- `.nix-bin-stubs/node` - Nix stub in workspace

mochaTestLens.workspaceRoot.description: Root directory of the workspace. Leave empty to auto-detect from VS Code workspace folders.
mochaTestLens.workspaceRoot.markdownDescription:
Root directory of the workspace. Leave empty to auto-detect from VS Code workspace folders.

This is useful when working with monorepos or when the workspace root differs from the VS Code workspace folder.

scripts.prepublishOnly: npm run test && npm run lint && npm run prettier:check && npm audit --audit-level=moderate
